definition: to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to

sentences.english: Fuel should be spread evenly over the grate surface.
sentences.chinese: 應將燃料均勻地播撒在爐篦表面。

sentences.english: E'en as a hand-grenade, that scatters destruction around it.
sentences.chinese: 就像一隻手雷，把毀滅向四周播撒。

sentences.english: Anyone who uses it "can sow the seeds of non-violence.
sentences.chinese: 任何使用這個工具的人都爲非暴力播撒下了一粒種子。

sentences.english: This will sow the seeds of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 這將會播撒民主的種子。

sentences.english: Earth would thus have its first offspring, seeded by spaceship.
sentences.chinese: 地球將首次擁有子嗣，通過宇宙飛船來播撒希望之種。

definition: to sprinkle/to shed (tears, blood etc)/fig. free, unconstrained/to write in a free style
to grow (usually of abstract things)/to yield/to develop
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
to permeate/to percolate/fig. to saturate (with emotion)
